revised_title: Gating Properties of Two Classes of cGMP-Activated Channels in Vertebrate Photoreceptors
tldr: The authors discovered two types of cGMP-activated channels in vertebrate photoreceptors, with different gating properties. The most common class exhibits rapid flickering between open and closed states, while the second class has distinct open-close transitions. These findings suggest that the predominant form of the channel in vivo differs significantly from cloned channels and has more complex gating properties.
